title: Font of the word 'pericarp'.
content:
Does anyone know what font the word 'pericarp' is in? (see image) I thought it was a modified Baskerville, but I have reasons to doubt.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160837im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FontID_5467.png)

Font: 

 Century Schoolbook 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160837/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [FontID.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160837/http:/typophile.com/files/FontID_1.png) | 48.36 KB |
author: iamjacobrussell

comments.content:
Looks like a customized version of Century Schoolbook (|mangosteen is the same typeface, just unaltered):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/monotype-century-schoolbook/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160837/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/monotype-century-schoolbook/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/monotype-century-schoolbook/")
